structure.unit: OFFENSES AGAINST PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY

law.catch_line: New contracts for personal emergency response system services -- Components -- Existing contracts.

text.section:
For contracts existing between a personal emergency response system provider and a customer prior to January 1, 2009:
A personal emergency response system provider shall, by January 1, 2009:
Mail a notice to each customer giving the customer the option of adding a 911 center, public safety answering point, or communications center as the primary responder as provided in this section; and
Provide the customer with a toll-free number by which to contact the personal emergency response system provider in order to establish a modified protocol for the customer; and
If the customer does not contact the personal emergency response system provider to change his or her protocol, the existing protocol shall remain in place between the customer and the personal emergency response system provider.

law.history: Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 102, sec. 3, effective July 15, 2008.
